**POSTURE 6 || UNLIT INCANT**
[[size 55%]] @@ @@ [[/size]]
[[size 75%]]Not to be handled by any member of the peasantry or those descended from bloodlines therein; any whose allegiances are reasonably suspected of falling with foreign powers; any disgraced members of the clergy; any who have defamed Her Immortal Majesty the Queen (Defender of the Realm, Executor of Seven Sacred Wills, Bearer of the Peregrine Blade, from whom all boons and blessings flow); any who have broken oaths great or small; any who abandoned their posts in times of fire; any who summon spirits for binding within illicit technologies.[[/size]]
[[/=]]


**SOURCE:** Multistream intelligence 

**DATE:** 11 Toiller, 901st year of Her Immortal Majesty the Queen's reign, may it outlast every heavenly body and persist another thousand centuries beyond

**FLAG:** Foreign influence, forbidden technology, HUMINT, PROPHINT, Cherinmark, banditry, Investigation #519, Investigation #660, POSTURE TOPICS (6, 8, 12)

**REPORTING:**
1.  CAMBRIA sensors detect emissions linked to {{{EX-ARC PULL: [[[SCP-7636]]]}}} at 81% confidence on 2/54/901

2. Those attuned to sorcererous energies, as well as a known master of haruspicy, independently determine that a resonant tragedy occurred near or within the Cherinmark Designated Disposal Zone on 2/54/901

3. HUMINT previously gathered from the area establishes:
> 3.1. Transient foreign community in Cherinmark remains agitated after the deaths of several adventuring parties within its borders (outside areas historically recognized as dungeons, lairs, or delving zones)
> 
> 3.2. Communities bordering Cherinmark also agitated over deaths. Local investigators have yet to identify motive or suspects 
> 
> 3.3. Foundation liaisons have met with other foreigners in the area (estimated to have begun 10/38/900, participants unknown); perceived to be marshaling support for self-governance despite standing agreements 
> 
> 3.4. {{{EX-ARC PULL: SCP-7636-13}}} rumored to have been recovered from Fort Gräd. State-sponsored actors are in pursuit (see: Investigation #519); various non-state, non-sponsored actors are also in pursuit (see: Investigation #660)
> 
> @@  @@ • 3.4.1. All actors engaging through local hunters and/or thieves guild cutouts
> 
> @@  @@ • 3.4.2. Confessions extracted by MIDAR confirm voluntary reporting
> 
> 3.5. Unreliable, single-source reporting flags Foundation liaison "Mealworm" as provoking unrest described in 3.1/3.2 and potentially participating in 3.4 action. "Mealworm" was marked deceased in Foundation exit reports
> 
> @@ @@ • 3.5.1. Royal onomancy cannot confirm due to clear pseudonym use
> 
> 3.6. {{{POSTURE 8 TOPIC}}}

4. At the Master of Whispers' request, drakes are dispatched from Aerie #10 on 3/4/901 to gather information without activating national assets. Overflight of the Peliogar and Ultigar border regions reveals no unusual activity, amulets detect no unusual energies

5. Drakes again dispatched on 3/5/901 to survey territories including Cherinmark (denial zone penetration not authorized). Riders observe deforestation around three unregistered silos and note paths leading deeper into neutral territory

6. Royal agents determine on 3/6/901 that a buried hanger built to store at least 50 {{{POSTURE 12 TOPIC}}} was not reported in violation of disarmament treaties

**FURTHER ACTION:**
__Preference:__ If, in her wisdom, in her ineffable grace, Her Immortal Majesty seeks to ascertain where these hidden weapons of war have been delivered and for what purpose, there could be no swifter means than dispatching deniable MIDAR teams into Cherinmark under the guise of "adventurers seeking a peerless blade." Several score should be undetectable within the influx currently underway, and would provide a contact surface with transient communities as well as agents of those poxed claimants to inferior crowns.

__Alternate:__ If instead seeking to display what might resides within the Saltmade Throne, to humble worms yet crawling, Her Immortal Majesty might be advised to dispatch the fifth and sixth royal battalions for peacekeeping operations in tandem with a more thorough search. This is permitted under standing treaties for a period of no more than 90 days, although objections are likely to rise before that cutoff—wasted paper when lodged in our Sovereign's light. 

__Not favored:__ Inaction (although, as but humble subjects, wandering blind through the night of royal affairs, we could not hope to understand the fullness of Her Immortal Majesty's decisions or judge their wisdom without first donning jester's garb).
